title: Mapping the impact of gut microbiota on brain and behaviour through the lens of GABA
descriptions:
The proposed project, "Mapping the impact of gut microbiota on brain and behaviour through the lens of GABA," aims to address the knowledge gap surrounding the influence of gut-produced neurotransmitters, specifically GABA, on human brain function and behavior. Leveraging a biochemically informed approach, the project will explore the modulation of brain GABA levels and GABA-ergic task performance by gut bacteria in human adults using Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy. Additionally, the project will investigate the effects of ingested GABA-producing bacteria on brain function and behavior over a four-week period through the administration of a custom-made probiotic intervention.

With a focus on GABA, an inhibitory neurotransmitter known to play a crucial role in regulating neural excitability, the project will shed light on the intricate relationship between gut microbiota, GABA levels in the brain, and human behavior. By utilizing both direct and proxy measures in the assay methods, the project will provide a comprehensive understanding of how gut bacteria and probiotics impact brain GABA levels and function.

This interdisciplinary research effort brings together experts in psychology, neuroscience, and gut microbiology to explore new frontiers in understanding individual differences in human behavior and brain function. By uncovering the intricate interplay between gut microbiota and brain neurotransmitters, the project has the potential to revolutionize our understanding of the gut-brain axis and pave the way for innovative interventions targeting brain health and behavior.
